thread.title: Sri Lanka seal series win over West Indies
thread.title_full: Sri Lanka seal series win over West Indies

title: Sri Lanka seal series win over West Indies
text:
Sri Lanka seal series win over West Indies 26 Oct 2015 09:46:59 
comments 
Sri Lanka defeated West Indies by 72 runs in a rain-hit low-scoring second Test to take the series 2-0. 
Rain had washed out day four in Colombo and left the tourists, who were chasing a victory target of 244, to begin the final day at the P Sara Oval on 20 for one. 
But any hopes they had of salvaging a draw were ended by Rangana Herath and Milinda Siriwardana. 
Siriwardana finished the match with 110 runs out of Sri Lanka's total of 406 for two innings and with five wickets, including three for 25 in the West Indies' second innings. 
Herath returned second innings figures of four for 56 as the tourists failed to see out the final day. 
Darren Bravo's 61 was the backbone of the West Indies' effort but he was the second of four victims for Herath, who also accounted for Denesh Ramdin, Kemar Roach and Jerome Taylor. 
Roach was the fourth highest scorer for the tourists with 13 and he prolonged the outcome in a battling 10th wicket partnership of 33 with tail-ender Jomel Warrican. 
With an unbeaten 20 from 27 balls, including three fours, Warrican took the fight to Sri Lanka until he ran out of partners. 
With plenty of time and overs left in the day the West Indies effort was brought to a close off the penultimate ball of the 66th over. 
Herath beat Roach's inside edge with the batsman looking to defend and, despite the lbw decision going to review, claimed the final wicket to secure the Test win and series victory for the home side. 
Sri Lanka had won the first Test in Galle inside four days by an innings and six runs. Related Sport News
